com.cinchapi.concourse.db

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cinchapi.concourse.db.Cell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteSized, Locatable, Persistable

    public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
implements Persistable, Locatable

    Represents a Value set contained at the intersection of a Row and Column. Only a single cell can exist at this intersection, so each is Locatable using a 32 byte hash derived from the row Key and the Column Name. After construction, the cell does not maintain any explicit knowledge of its housing row or column.

    Each cell has two variable length components:

    • State - An immutable snapshot of the forStorage values currently in the cell. The state for the cell changes whenever a revision occurs.
    • History - A list of forStorage values sorted by timestamp in ascending order. Every time a revision for a value occurs, that value is logged in the history. From the perspective of the history, a value V is considered present at time T if there are an odd number of values in the history equal to V with a timestamp less than or equal to T.

    Storage Requirements

    • The size required for the state is the summation of the size of each values plus 4 bytes. A state (and therefore a cell) can theoretically hold up to 107374182 values at once, but in actuality this limit is much lower.
    • The size required for the history is the product of 4 times the total number of revisions plus the summation of the size of each value multiplied by the number revisions with that value. A history can theoretically hold up to 107374182 revisions, but in actuality this limit is much lower.
    Note: The size of the Cell is guranteed to increase by at least the size of V for each revision involving V. Therefore, removing a value from a Cell will not reduce the size of the cell, but will increase it!

    Note: All the methods in this class are synchronized to prevent state from changing in the middle of an operation

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    jnelson

        public static final int MAX_NUM_VALUES

        public void writeTo(java.nio.channels.FileChannel channel)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Persistable
        Write the object to a writable channel. This method should acquire a lock over the region from the channels current position plus the ByteSized.size() of the value. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the channel is in the correct position before and after this method has run. In general, call Persistable.Writer.write(Persistable, FileChannel) from this method.
